page.title: 20The Abbey Church.
page.content: The Abbey Church seats 800 plus 85 monks in the choir stalls. The crypt has many chapels. The design is stark throughout the Church and the only relief is in the choir. Various types of stone have been used inside and outside. The choir section on the outside is faced with{Bramley Fall} stone and the inside with{Blue Horton} stone. The rest of the Church is externally faced with{Dunhouse}stone. The church includes the splendid high altar built by Giles Scott. The wooden furnishings especially in the choir of the Abbey have been made by{Thompson {of Kilburn}whose trademark is a carved mouse. A tile on the south side of the Abbey shows the link between the modern Ampleforth Benedictine Community and the original Westminster one.
